| Section5 = {{Chembox Related Function = alkanamines OtherFunctn = OtherCpds =
}} }} 'Ethylamine' is an organic compound with the formula
CH 3CH 2NH 2. This colourless gas has a strong ammonia-
like odor. It is miscible with virtually all solvents and is a weak base, as is
typical for amines. Ethylamine is widely used in chemical industry and organic
synthesis.

pK a (of protonated form) = 10.7 Wilson and Gisvold's Textbook of
